Explanations about Options.-l(C): Answering your first question: given you have an MBR there, I suggest you do something like "dd"'ing the first megabyte of the original drive (that contains the boot record and possibly the boot loader), then iterating over the partitions contained therein: "dev=/dev/sda fdisk -l "$dev" | sed -ne '/^\//s,\(^[^ ]*\) .*,\1,p' | while read part do dd "if=$part" "of=$(basename "$part")" done" And after you record the first megabyte to the target drive, ask the kernel to read the partition table with "partprobe" or "kpartx".
